attributes.action: Modernise and Amend The Highways Act of 1835
attributes.background: The Highways Act of 1835 is preventing Tech Startups and Global Business specialising in PLEV's (Personal Light Electronic Vehicle) from trading in the UK. It will also increase capacity of our cities by getting people off public transport and having fewer cars on the road.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see... http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Will4/5-6/50/section/LXXII/enacted

The purpose of this partition is to ask the government to change the law so that PLEV's (Electronic Scooters)can be ridden in public areas. Currently they are banned from both Pavements and Roads. PLEV's are a cost effective environmentally friendly emission free way of getting around a city. PLEV's also need a classification as a vehicle type as a part of this in the same way as Electronic Bikes are classified

attributes.action: Require sanctions for breaches of the Ministerial Code
attributes.background: Ministers breaking the ministerial code result in a report describing the breach - action may not be taken. The code should be given some force e.g. minor technical breach - an apology to Parliament: Deliberate major breach - a lifetime ban on being a Minister.
attributes.additional_details: In cases where it is found there has been a deliberate major breach, the individual, and any other who behaved similarly, could not be relied upon to abide by the code in future and would therefore be unfit to be a Minister. A right of appeal to a court should exist in the event of such a sanction.

attributes.action: Make new commercial buildings have solar panels unless good reason can be given
attributes.background: The roofs of commercial buildings could provide clean, cheap electricity to the grid. Frequently this space is not used for this purpose. Unless there are good reasons not to fit them, such as not fitting in with the local environment or bring prohibitevly expensive, they should be fitted.

attributes.action: Amend the BBC Charter to require it to make achieved content freely available.
attributes.background: The BBC has many decades worth of programming that is currently not available to license paying residents of Britain. As the BBC Charter does not currently mandate that it is made available to said residents it is not possible to watch more than a fraction of this content.
attributes.additional_details: We ask the Parliament and the Government to amend the BBC Charter to require the BBC to make all of its archived content available to license paying British residents.

attributes.action: Introduce a statue of limitations for Army veterans
attributes.background: British Army veterans are being investigated for alleged wrongdoings that took place over 40 years ago in Northern Ireland , even though in many cases they were thoroughly investigated at the time . The introduction of a statute of limitations would prevent this from happening in the future .

attributes.action: Remove the 2 year restriction on a 125cc motorcycle upon completion of the CBT.
attributes.background: If you can ride a 125cc for 2 years why not permanently.

attributes.action: To dedicate more resources to help men and young boys with mental health issues
attributes.background: As a young man, I’m scared to see statistics about male suicides. It is shocking that very little is being done to tackle the problem of mental health, and more needs to be done to help men and young boys with depression, anxiety and stress among with other issues
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11787304/Homelessness-is-a-gendered-issue-and-it-mostly-impacts-men.html

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/deaths/bulletins/suicidesintheunitedkingdom/2016registrations#main-points

attributes.action: Make all goods vehicles to have speed limiters set at the national speed limit
attributes.background: Legislation needs to be in place making all goods vehicles speed limiters set at the national speed limit in order to reduce overtaking . At present hauliers set their vehicles at a speed of their choice. This causes bunching of LGV's and causes unnecessary overtaking .

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoples’ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you needn’t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Introduce sanctions for Whaling nations if the hunting of Whales does not cease.
attributes.background: These countries are hunting a protected species on the pretense they're for scientific research. In reality the Whale meat is for public consumption. The three countries actually trade the meat between themselves despite an international trade ban. Whaling quotas are actually increasing.
attributes.additional_details: Feb 2018 more than 120 pregnant female whales were among 333 killed during Japan’s annual summer hunt in Antarctica. Mar 2018, Norway has announced a 28% increase of its annual whaling quota to 1,278 whales to revive the declining hunt amid international controversy. Jun 2018, Iceland’s whaling season have granted its whalers a quota of 161 fin whales in 2018, compared to 150 in 2017. Jul 2018, Icelandic Whalers kill an endangered Blue Whale...a protected species.

attributes.action: Lower Company Car Tax (BIK) on all company cars
attributes.background: Fewer people are now paying company car tax but the Government takes in excess of £360m extra revenue,funds from company car drivers has increased by 24% each year. WLTP is going to make some cars go up in bandings despite the EU dictating that the driver should not have to pay more until April2020.
attributes.additional_details: The latest figures published in fleet news is bad news for company car drivers and car dealers alike.  Drivers have seen tax hikes like no other and are often middle earners, not high earners.

attributes.action: Parents must be told if the other parent is convicted of child sex offenses
attributes.background: Parents must be told if their ex is convicted of child sex offenses, even if they don’t have contact with the children at that time.

attributes.action: Increase Child Benefit to £40 per child per week
attributes.background: There are 4.1 Million children in poverty in the UK. And another new 753 children fall in to poverty each day. The best way to tackle it is by increasing child benefits, so this will not prevent people from getting in to work, getting better jobs or better salaries as there is no taper rate for CB.
attributes.additional_details:
67% of children in poverty are from working families. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-39291999
http://www.cpag.org.uk/content/child-poverty-facts-and-figures

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty_in_the_United_Kingdom#Poverty_in_the_UK_in_the_21st_century

https://www.google.co.uk/search?ei=m9U8W8DoGYuvgQb-6Z_IAg&q=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&oq=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&gs_l=psy-ab.3...10100.19683.0.20219.16.16.0.0.0.0.96.903.16.16.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..0.4.241...33i160k1.0.mWs7Ge3vIsw&safe=active&ssui=on

attributes.action: Introduce yearly mental health checks on the NHS
attributes.background: With how society is nowadays, it is very easy to find yourself struggling. An annual mental health check will give everyone a chance to talk about their feelings to a trained professional who will be able to react to this in a more proactive way than a friend who may not know how to deal with it.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide is now at its all time highest, with it being the most common cause of death for men aged 20-49 across England and Wales. More and more pressures have emerged that we as humans were not originally designed to deal with such as financial worries, the rise of social media and having demanding jobs so there is no wonder 1 in 15 of us have made a suicide attempt at some point in our lives.

attributes.action: Withdraw the sovereignty of the U.S embassy & send the U.S ambassadors home
attributes.background: In light of the atrocities carried out by Donald Trump's administration in the name of "strong borders" we must not tolerate the human rights abuses carried out against migrant children and their families, it is clear we must cut all ties with America.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is evidence of the crimes against immigrants held in detention centres.
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-detention-center-separated-parents.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/us-immigration-children-audio-trump-border-patrol-separate-families-parents-detention-center-a8405501.html
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-allegedly-drugged-abused-in-shelters.html
What is happening to these children and their families is abhorrent.

attributes.action: Support the 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' to regulate nurdle handling
attributes.background: Nurdles are small plastic pellets used in the production of plastic products.  Due to poor handling and lack of regulation, nurdles have become a huge source of pollution to our oceans and waterways.  Visit https://cans.blog to see more.
attributes.additional_details: Once spilt into marine environments nurdles absorb toxic chemicals and pose an immediate danger to wildlife as their size makes them easily mistaken for food.  The 'Campaign Against Nurdle Spills' has written a piece of secondary legislation that specifies methods to regulate all nurdle handling in the UK and UK waters.  This legislation will force anyone handling over 2KG of nurdles to be registered and agree to the highest standards of care when handling nurdles.

attributes.action: Change Abortion law to a period of 12 weeks instead of 24 weeks.
attributes.background: The Irish are proposing to introduce legislation that will restrict Category C abortions to 12 weeks, whilst we continue to allow abortions up to 24 weeks - far beyond the time when a baby can survive outside the womb.  This needs changed.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017 there were 194,668 legal abortions carried out in England & Wales (ie just over 745 abortions per working day). Of these, 98% (185,448) were carried out under category C. Of these, 99.5% were reported as being performed because of a risk to the woman’s mental health. In 13 cases, an abortion was performed under category C because of complications of pregnancy. Source - Abortion Statistics, England and Wales: 2017, Department of Health & Social Care

attributes.action: Add metric km/h to speed signs under the imperial mph sign.
attributes.background: So as the Metric system is a lot easier to convert lengths through I think we should convert our measurements to km/h while keeping the mph sign for old road users. I think we should add the km/h sign under the mph road sign with a different coloured ring (green maybe) and km/h after it.
attributes.additional_details: This would make it easier to judge distance for younger people as younger people are being taught the metric system. As most cars have km/h along side mph this would mean it would have almost instant impact. Also it is great for tourists and european people that come from a totally metric county drive safer.

attributes.action: Mandatory 5 year prison sentence for carrying a knife on the first offence
attributes.background: The streets of the United Kingdom have been lost to knife wielding thugs who suffer  little or no consequence for their actions. Social media and local news is awash with videos and images of knives on our streets. The two strike rule has failed. A mandatory 5 year sentence must be enforced for all.

attributes.action: Increase the national living wage for all UK workers over 18 to £10.50 per hour.
attributes.background: We are privileged to live in a nation of immense wealth and opportunity but it is a sad and shameful fact that this wealth is not more evenly distributed amongst the working population.
attributes.additional_details: It must be recognised by all that the social, educational and economic opportunities that are available to citizens who are paid the current living wage/minimum wage are considerably less than those individuals who are fortunate enough to earn more. Any civilised society should strive to protect its citizens from exploitation and hardship by ensuring that the national living wage is fair and equal for all workers over the age of 18 irrespective of contract or skill.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of Pyrotechnics at UK football grounds
attributes.background: The majority of countries within Europe and South America allow fans to use pyrotechnics such as smoke bombs and flares at football matches however current law states that in UK they are not allowed and the use of them can lead to stadium bans as well as custodial sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Football banning orders for use of pyrotechnics are at minimum 3 years through a court and can go up to 10 years. Even if you are caught with the smoke bomb in a bag search, the punishments can be just as harsh as if you had let it off.

attributes.action: Make mental health screening mandatory for young and adult offenders.
attributes.background: For too long people going through a mental health crisis are not given the needed support which results in them being put through the criminal justice system instead. This petition is asking for a mental health report to be mandatory before an offender appears before the courts.
attributes.additional_details: According to the National Audit Office in 2016 37% of prisoners in the UK where suffering from a mental health crisis in 2016. They also stated that in the same year there was 120 self inflicted deaths, and a reported 40,161 self harm incidents reported. The cost to the tax payer is staggering and these issues are causing unprecedented pressure on our prison and police services.

attributes.action: Reduce maximum stake Fixed Odds Betting Terminals from £100 to £2 by April 2019
attributes.background:
Chancellor Philip Hammond said in Monday's Budget that the in stakes from £100 to £2 would come into force in October 2019 not the agreed April 2019, this is totally unacceptable

The users of these machines are being sacrificed over Gambling Industry Profits.
attributes.additional_details:
"From the time of the announcement to reduce stakes and its implementation, over £1.6bn will be lost on these machines”

"In addition, two people will tragically take their lives every day due to gambling-related problems and, for that reason as much as any other, I believe this delay is unjustifiable." - Tracey Couch

Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds.

Please sign this petition to reduce the misery and risk of losing a loved one

attributes.action: Make it an offence to partake in and advertise 'trophy' hunting in the UK.
attributes.background: Recent posts on social media from Scotland show trophy hunters posing with deer, goats and even sheep which they have shot. Hunting is a contentious issue in the UK, but this type of hunting is purely based on commercial interests, often making profit for companies in other countries.

attributes.action: Include DBS check as a part of aplication for "settled status" after Brexit
attributes.background: This petition calls for adding a Criminal Record  check to the application for "settled status" for citizens of EEA  after Brexit. All European migrants should have clean DBS check to receive opportunity to settle down in United Kingdom after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has voted to leave the EU and this is one time opportunity to rid out those who not obey the law of United Kingdom. This could reduce crime rates, save thousands of pounds in insurance cost and trauma for victims at no cost to taxpayer. Those who fail to deliver clear DBS should be refused right to settle down in United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Require drivers to pass the UK driving test to be able to drive in the UK
attributes.background: The reason I believe that drivers from overseas should take the UK driving test is because there are too many accidents on the UK roads caused by drivers from overseas because the roads in the UK are different to many other countries.

attributes.action: Keep grants for plug-in hybrid & electric cars at their current levels or above
attributes.background: Sales of electric cars are starting to take off, but government action could stop it in its tracks. From 12 November onwards, the government will drop cash incentives even for the greenest plug-in hybrid cars. More seriously, the discount on full-electric vehicles will be cut from £4500 to £3500.
attributes.additional_details:
This action suggests the government doesn't care about the environment or encouraging adoption of low- and zero-emission vehicles. 

Nicholas Lyes from the RAC said the move was “a major blow to anyone hoping to go green with their next vehicle”. 

The AA's Jack Cousens: "This announcement will simply put more drivers off from buying greener cars."

More information 
Autocar -- https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/industry/mitsubishi-extremely-disappointed-end-government-plug-car-grants

BBC -- https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45831150

Original announcement:
Gov.uk -- https://www.gov.uk/government/news/reformed-plug-in-car-grant-extended-into-next-decade

attributes.action: Make it illegal for limited speed vehicles from overtaking on dual carriageways.
attributes.background: Lorries overtaking on dual carriageways takes a considerable amount of time and holds up all traffic behind them. This causes delays and considerable frustration to other road users, and dangerous driving results from impatient car drivers.
attributes.additional_details: The speed limit for lorries on a dual carriageways is 60mph. Cars and other vehicles are limited to 70mph. Considering the numbers of cars to other vehicles on the road, it is illogical to allow limited vehicles to block both carriageways for considerable lengths of time causing delays for many other road users.

attributes.action: workers on benefits should be able to do overtime when needed without deductions
attributes.background: Workers who claim benefits should be able to do overtime e.g. 20 hours, when needed, over a tax year to help in times of hardship. After the capped overtime hours have been used you cannot do anymore in that year.
attributes.additional_details: This proposal came about after I wanted to consider overtime to help me and my son, but I am unable to do so.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on fuel for the road haulage industry
attributes.background: Reduce fuel tax for the road haulage industry.
attributes.additional_details: Fuel is the biggest out may in road haulage. The cost is increasing and forcing small business into financial stuggle. The reduce in tax would encourage hauliers to expand and boost the economy. Increase wages run more fuel efficient/green vehicles

attributes.action: Introduce a 12-month residency requirement for candidates to Parliament
attributes.background: In order for Parliament to become truly representative, this petition proposes introducing legislation to require persons standing for Parliament to be resident in their constituency for at least 12 months prior to election day.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is meant to be a representative democracy.  However, parties will often choose a favoured member to run for a seat to maximise their chances of winning, even though they have no genuine connection to the local community.  As a result, Parliament is not a collection of community representatives, but a collection of preferred party members.

attributes.action: Stop charging students council tax on property rented for graduating year
attributes.background: Students are exempt from paying council tax however if a student is still living in student accommodation after they’ve graduated, they’re expected to pay the remaining months, even though their finically situation is still the same or most of the time, even worse.
attributes.additional_details: Contracts are only available for 12 months from most letting agents therefor trapping students into a fee that most of them can’t afford or have to pay with their student loan which is supposed to be used to help forward they’re education and living costs. We still have to pay this loan back and being forced to give a large amount of it away for a period of time in which you can’t control is very worrying. The exemption of students paying council tax should last their whole tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Set up a new homes ombudsman to address serious failings in the building sector.
attributes.background: A new independent ombudsman should have powers to impose large fines to the builders of inadequate new build homes. Failing this the builders should offer a refund to the buyers of substandard homes.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal experience of being sold a substandard home. I was advised by the estate agent that a surveyor was unnecessary as my home carried a 10 year warranty. After a couple of months I appointed a Surveyor due to concerns about the inadequate construction of my home, for example, ordered wardrobes to be fitted, unfortunately these couldn’t be fitted due to the sloping of the floors up to 14ml between one wall and the other.

It is is now nearly 12 months since I moved in - there are 112 defects of which 5 are serious.

attributes.action: Make Bonfire Night a National Holiday
attributes.background:
Between August bank holiday and Christmas there are no national holidays in the UK. This leaves millions of people with nothing to look forward to for months on end and has led to the overhyping of Christmas. 
We need another holiday to look forward to. We DESERVE another day of celebration.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we make Bonfire Night a national holiday. The Americans and Canadians have Thanksgiving but it doesn't seem right to copy this. 
Instead let's make the quintessentially British Bonfire Night a national holiday. 
Communities can come together and make/share food. Kids doing 'penny for the guy'. We need this. 
Let's make it happen!

attributes.action: Make it law that savings interest rates go up same time as loans & mortgages.
attributes.background: This last decade's rock-bottom interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest, because banks are quick to raise rates on loans & mortgages after BoE hikes, but are reluctant to offer the same, timely hikes for savings. Savers see this as immoral an highway robbery on our High Streets.
attributes.additional_details:
Before the 2008 crisis, from 1998 to 2007, savers earned £233 billion in interest. Following it, from 2008 to 2017, they earned just £129 billion because banks fail to pass on rate rises announced by the BoE.
Interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest payments https://dailym.ai/2ot5PJ3 
Millions of savers are being hit by rip-off rates https://dailym.ai/2PzyEin
 
We request that our MP's debate this in Parliament and create a new law that will enforce timely equitable treatment for interest rates on savings and retrospectively make good the deficit.

attributes.action: We believe Wythenshawe Community Initiative deserves more funding
attributes.background: Wythenshawe Community Initiative are a child daycare centre that provide a safe space for children to play and be looked after, whilst parents are working. Everyday they have children and parents lining up to get a place in however many are turned away due to lack of funding and staff.
attributes.additional_details:
They are a non-profit organisation, based in Manchester and are for children from the ages of five to eleven. 

In 2017 they fundraised £3,498.52 but this is nowhere near enough to support the centre. Many children who turn up at the centre go without breakfast and staff struggle to provide them with enough food due to the lack of money.

attributes.action: Do not endorse Zimbabwe’s harmonised 2018 elections
attributes.background: There is growing evidence that the outcome of Zimbabwe’s harmonised elections was not a result of a free and fair electoral process. This was followed by post-election violence and the alleged slaughter and beatings of civilians by the army.
attributes.additional_details:
Abductions and an intensified crackdown on the opposition is ongoing.

As an activist, and with many Zimbabweans I am appealing to the UK parliament and government to: - suspend further economic, bilateral engagement with Zimbabwe's govt until there is clarity on its human rights situation; -recognise the unsafe political environment in Zimbabwe for opposition and activists; -strongly support concerns raised by EU, Zimbabwe Human Rights Groups and the USA on elections in Zimbabwe; put pressure on Zimbabwe's govt to account for the killing of innocent civilians by the army.

attributes.action: Make overtime tax free
attributes.background: We pay tax on our standard hours so we should get our overtime tax free

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the USA
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I am now 21 years of age and at an age where I feel I can make judgement on who MY father should be. The fact that I cannot be adopted my a man who has stood by me for years because I am “too old” is completely against my rights.
attributes.additional_details: I intend on getting the law changed so that myself and others can make this descision. Many people do it for different reasons. It should be a choice that can be made at any time in an adults life.

attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: All English Local Authorities to notify residents by post of new Consultations
attributes.background: When introducing any legislation affecting residents, The Local Authority/Council must serve notice of any consultation or proposal directly on ALL residents, in additional languages if required, by way of postal service. Local Authorities across England are failing to comply with this requirement
attributes.additional_details: A specific example of this is the introduction of Selective Licensing in Luton, ALL residents in the affected areas have not been informed of the Consultation. The outcome of this consultation will affect all residents of Luton. We are asking for people across England to support this if they have had a similar experience with their Local Authority failing to consult with them on important changes affecting their town/city.

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.

attributes.action: Offer support to Greece regarding the Mati Wildfire Crisis
attributes.background: The Mati wildfire has burned through village, causing 74 fatalities so far, with that number "expected to rise", and with little control over the fire. The United Kingdom should offer assistance in the form of firefighters, aircraft and vehicles to assist the struggling victims of the fire.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.reviewjournal.com/news/nation-and-world/death-toll-from-greece-fires-reaches-74-is-expected-to-rise/amp/

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave to at least 4 weeks so fathers can bond with their child.
attributes.background: Being a father and being there for your new born baby is so important at the early stages of life, to bond and make that connect this needs to happen early on in a baby's life, also helping your partner out with the night and day duties taking some of that pressure off the mother.
attributes.additional_details: How can men and women truly be treated equally if the father only get 1-2 week paternity leave and the mother gets up 26 weeks with full pay and 26 weeks additional weeks half pay depending on the company. This is such a serious matter and should be looked into carefully in the best interest of the baby and parents no matter the sex.

attributes.action: Prevent absent parents from travelling outside the UK if maintenance is unpaid
attributes.background: Recently Australia enforced action against parents with child support debts from travelling in and out of the country until they had settled their arrears. Introducing a similar law into the UK would benefit many UK families and make absent parents face up to their responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/may/27/child-support-debts-record-number-of-parents-prevented-from-travelling-overseas

attributes.action: Ban Staples From Newspapers
attributes.background: Staples are an unnecessary addition to newspapers which are an environmental liability - this petition asks the government to ban the use of staples in newspaper production.
attributes.additional_details:
Staples are for the most part made using steel which is produced with the requirement of a blast furnace and this using large amounts of energy. No staples would also mean that newspapers would be more easily recyclable due to the absence of metal and the decay of newspapers would be much increased.
Banning staples would bring down production costs for newspaper companies And would create a safer environment in factories.

attributes.action: Introduce retesting every ten years for drivers/driving license.
attributes.background: Every driver falls into bad habits or are not up to date with the current rules of the road, after driving for years. They put themselves, and others at risk. If we introduce that every driver must re-take their test every ten years, more drivers would be better informed of the rules of the road.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also create more jobs, eg more driving teachers/testers. Every ten years when it’s time to re-take your driving test, the first retake would be free, however, if you fail, you must pay the same cost as your first ever tests.

Also if your main job is driving eg delivery trucks, perhaps the re-take test time should be every 5 years.

All in all this would mean more money for the government, safer drivers with drivers being better informed thus making safer roads.

attributes.action: Work with EU to allow promotion/marketing of infant formula milk(under 6months)
attributes.background: Currently you are unable to to gain advantage points from supermarkets and reatailers such as boots on formula milk (for under 6 months) you can also not buy formula with these advantage points. This is due to a law that prevents the promotion or discount of formula milk for under 6 month olds.
attributes.additional_details: the price of formula is regulated as to stop 'formula shopping' and prevent people from buying the cheapest formula they can find, as this enables mother/fathers to use one brand or staggared brands through out infancy- they were finding that babies where becoming really unwell by getting fed different formulas every week. It also prevents supermarkets trying to push formula that is close to expire. But parents should be able to gain advantage points on buying formula milk.

attributes.action: Prohibit the manafacture and commercial distribution of cigarettes within the UK
attributes.background:
Ever hour around the world, 800 people die as a result of the most lethal human creation - cigarettes. These small paper rolls kill more people on average around the globe than AK47's

So why is it so ironic that countries prohibit smoking in public but still allow toxic tobacco manufacturing ?
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 4 million hectares of deforestation for cigarette fuels and paper wrapping.

This industry kills 7 million people ever year

So why can we as humans not recognise that this substance would be better off if completely irradicated. Why is it seen as though the manafacturers care more about their profits than the health of people around the globe. 

And unfortunately, "smoking kills" just isn't enough.

attributes.action: Fine parents who refuse to have regular contact with their children.
attributes.background: Parents who choose not see their children regularly subject them to feelings of abandonment. More action and strict policies should be in place to enforce regular contact. Where possible, children need their both parents.
